name: Letter from Castaneda, Joannes de to Clusius, Carolus, 160X-XX-XX

Diplomatic.text:
<body>Magister <ab id="9026475"/>Johanes de Castaneda<ae id="9026475"/> Matanza artium et medicinae doctor sapientissimo, amantissimoque suo viro prudenti in universitate civitatis Leyde, Caro <ab id="9026476"/>Clusio<ae id="9026476"/>: ut decies eius nomen, in carminibus
 legatur.
 D         C         O
 Cantu, nec seCus laeto aC ambulaChro
 Ambis quas, mActe dryAdes consertA
 Restituant Rosis et neReydes seRta
 Ovantes pOst quam cerulO in lavachrO
 Lausque fuLgenti ilLustrans simuLachro
 VirorVm cultV AtrebatVm referta
 Symbola, hoc poStquam reSonans deSerta
 Camenae Choro conCinat de saChro
 Liliisque ampLectens Lauro te Labetur.
 Viam, iam Virgo, qVi tenes sec Vram
 Sub eterniS nec alteriuS tritam Solo:
 Indice trIum at te, tImeo desIgnetur
 Vim iterVm, ne refVga, pass Vram
 Se dubitanS, aut siSne et ipSe Apollo</body>

metadata.value: Edition: J. L. Barona & X. Gómez i Font (introd. & transl.), La correspondencia de Carolus Clusius con los científicos españoles (Valencia 1998).
Not a letter, but a poem and a dried plant.
